prime.layout.algorithms.tile.DynamicTileAlgorithm

type
class
extends
TileAlgorithmBase
implements
prime.layout.algorithms.ILayoutAlgorithm
available in
cpp, cs, java, js, neko, php, swf
metadata
:build
'???'
:keep
FixedTileAlgorithm will place a fixed number of tiles in one row or column. DynamicTileAlgorithm will place as many tiles as possible in one row or column. The amount of tiles in one row or column will be defined by the explicitWidth and explicitHeight of the layoutgroup on which the algorithm is applied.

Constructor

new(?startDir : prime.core.geom.space.Direction, ?horDirection : prime.core.geom.space.Horizontal, ?verDirection : prime.core.geom.space.Vertical)

cpp, js, neko, php, swf

startDirection(default,accessor) : prime.core.geom.space.Direction

inherited from prime.layout.algorithms.tile.TileAlgorithmBase
Defines in which direction the layout will start calculating.

tileGroups(default,null) : TileContainer

tileGroups is a TileContainer containing a reference to each TileContainer The tileGroups property is responsible for setting the correct x or y position of each tilegroup. tileGroups (TileContainer) -> children (ListCollection) -> tileGroup0 (TileContainer) -> children (ChainedList) -> tileGroup1 (TileContainer) -> children (ChainedList) -> etc.
